Package frisbee.puf.backend.controller

Class TeamController

java.lang.Object
frisbee.puf.backend.controller.TeamController
@CrossOrigin @RestController @RequestMapping("/api") public class TeamController extends Object

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?>
    createTeam(String name)
    Maps to a POST request on the /teams/create endpoint and passes the submitted name String to the TeamService instance in order to create a new team with the provided name.
    org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?>
    getActiveTeamByPlayer(String email)
    Maps to a GET request on the /teams/player/{email}/active endpoint and passes the submitted player email String to the TeamService instance in order to get all active teams this particular player is a member of.
    org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?>
    getTeamByName(String name)
    Maps to a GET request on the /teams/{name} endpoint and passes the submitted name String to the TeamService instance in order to get the corresponding Team object.
    org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?>
    getTeamByPlayer(String email)
    Maps to a GET request on the /teams/player/{email} endpoint and passes the submitted player email String to the TeamService instance in order to get all teams this particular player is a member of.
    org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Team>>
    getTeams()
    Maps to a get request on the teams endpoint and returns all existing teams.
    org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?>
    joinTeam(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.node.ObjectNode objectNode)
    Maps to a POST request on the /teams/join endpoint and passes the submitted team name and player email to the TeamService instance in order to add the player to an existing team.
    org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?>
    updateTeam(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.node.ObjectNode objectNode)
    Maps to a PUT request on the /teams/update endpoint and passes the submitted team name, level, score, lives and status to the TeamService instance in order to update an existing team.

  • Method Details

    • getTeams

      @GetMapping("/teams") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Team>> getTeams()
      Maps to a get request on the teams endpoint and returns all existing teams.
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity object containing the HTTP status and a list of all Team objects that are stored in the database

    • getTeamByName

      @GetMapping("/teams/{name}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getTeamByName(@PathVariable("name") String name)
      Maps to a GET request on the /teams/{name} endpoint and passes the submitted name String to the TeamService instance in order to get the corresponding Team object.
      Parameters:
      name - the team's name
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity object, containing the HTTP status and the Team object in case of success, a NoSuchElementException otherwise

    • getTeamByPlayer

      @GetMapping("/teams/player/{email}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getTeamByPlayer(@PathVariable("email") String email)
      Maps to a GET request on the /teams/player/{email} endpoint and passes the submitted player email String to the TeamService instance in order to get all teams this particular player is a member of.
      Parameters:
      email - the player's email
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity object, containing the HTTP status and a list of Team objects in case of success, a NoSuchElementException otherwise

    • getActiveTeamByPlayer

      @GetMapping("/teams/player/{email}/active") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getActiveTeamByPlayer(@PathVariable("email") String email)
      Maps to a GET request on the /teams/player/{email}/active endpoint and passes the submitted player email String to the TeamService instance in order to get all active teams this particular player is a member of.
      Parameters:
      email - the player's email
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity object, containing the HTTP status and a list of Team objects in case of success, a NoSuchElementException otherwise

    • createTeam

      @PostMapping("/teams/create") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> createTeam(@RequestBody String name)
      Maps to a POST request on the /teams/create endpoint and passes the submitted name String to the TeamService instance in order to create a new team with the provided name.
      Parameters:
      name - the team's name
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity object, containing the HTTP status and the team object in case of success, an IllegalArgumentException otherwise

    • joinTeam

      @PostMapping("/teams/join") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> joinTeam(@RequestBody com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.node.ObjectNode objectNode)
      Maps to a POST request on the /teams/join endpoint and passes the submitted team name and player email to the TeamService instance in order to add the player to an existing team.
      Parameters:
      objectNode - contains the team's name and the player's email
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity object, containing the HTTP status and the team object in case of success, an Exception otherwise

    • updateTeam

      @PutMapping("/teams/update") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updateTeam(@RequestBody com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.node.ObjectNode objectNode)
      Maps to a PUT request on the /teams/update endpoint and passes the submitted team name, level, score, lives and status to the TeamService instance in order to update an existing team.
      Parameters:
      objectNode - contains the team's name, level, score, lives and status
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity object, containing the HTTP status and the team object in case of success, an Exception otherwise
